utils

Class Messenger

  • java.lang.Object
    • utils.Messenger

  • public class Messenger
extends java.lang.Object
    class controlling messaging to various output streams. Used for logging purposes as an alterntative to log4j. The class methods are all thread-safe (i.e. reentrant)

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2018

    Company:

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int _dbgLvl
      _dbgLvl declared volatile in a manner that is consistent even for JDK1.4 memory model.
      private static java.util.HashMap _instances
      all Messenger objects "live" in this map, which holds them by name.
      private java.io.PrintStream _os
      _os is the PrintStream on which this Messenger object sends its messages.
      private boolean _showTimeStamp
      _showTimeStamp forces each message to print the timestamp in the beginning of the message.

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private Messenger(java.io.OutputStream os)
      private constructor in accordance with the Singleton(s) Design Pattern.

      sends the msg to the PrintStream of this Messenger iff the debug level lvl is less than or equal to the debug level set by a prior call to setDebugLevel(dlvl).

      set a "debug level" to be later used for printing out messages according to the debug level of the message.

    • Field Detail

      • _os

        private java.io.PrintStream _os
        _os is the PrintStream on which this Messenger object sends its messages.

      • _dbgLvl

        private volatile int _dbgLvl
        _dbgLvl declared volatile in a manner that is consistent even for JDK1.4 memory model. Default value is Integer.MAX_VALUE for printing all messages of any debug level.

      • _showTimeStamp

        private boolean _showTimeStamp
        _showTimeStamp forces each message to print the timestamp in the beginning of the message.

      • _instances

        private static final java.util.HashMap _instances
        all Messenger objects "live" in this map, which holds them by name. Default messenger is named "default", and goes to System.err (stderr) print stream.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Messenger

        private Messenger(java.io.OutputStream os)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        private constructor in accordance with the Singleton(s) Design Pattern.
        Parameters:
        os - OutputStream
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the os argument is null

        public void close()
        close the PrintStream stream associated with this Messenger, flushing any unwritten content before.

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(java.lang.Object[] array)
        utility print method for object arrays.
        Parameters:
        array - Object[]
        Returns:
        String

      • setDebugLevel

        public void setDebugLevel(int lvl)
        set a "debug level" to be later used for printing out messages according to the debug level of the message. Not synchronized since _dbgLvl is volatile, and is only read/written, not incremented or modified in other ways.
        Parameters:
        lvl - int

      • getDebugLvl

        public int getDebugLvl()
        get the current "debug level" of this Messenger object.
        Returns:
        int

      • setShowTimeStamp

        public void setShowTimeStamp()
        force this Messenger to print the current time when showing any message via msg(String).

      • setShowTimeStamp

        public void setShowTimeStamp(boolean v)
        set the value of the member _showTimeStamp, used in showing time-stamps before every message.
        Parameters:
        v - boolean

      • getShowTimeStamp

        public boolean getShowTimeStamp()
        get the current value of the member _showTimeStamp of this Messenger.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • msg

        public void msg(java.lang.String msg,
                int lvl)
        sends the msg to the PrintStream of this Messenger iff the debug level lvl is less than or equal to the debug level set by a prior call to setDebugLevel(dlvl). When the debug-level argument is not enough to get printed, the method does not synchronize (though the access to _dbgLvl is essentially a "memory barrier".)
        Parameters:
        msg - String
        lvl - int
